title: Assistant Professor Interview
Interview Descriptions: Many meetings over 2 days, teaching and research talks.  Meeting with students and faculty.  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - ---------

title: Advancement Associate Interview
Interview Descriptions: A general phone interview with an HR representative followed by an interview with supervisors. Everything was clearly communicated and the interviewers asked insightful questions while putting the candidate at ease.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Interview Descriptions: Average interview. HR was great to talk to, but the people from the area I was applying to were awkward and the manager didn’t seem to hear what I was saying most of the time.

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Wheaton College (IL) (Wheaton, IL) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted my resume and website portfolio for review and then received a call from HR for a phone interview. The person interviewing me was 15 minutes late in calling, this was a prescheduled interview made by their HR department.
My rapport with the woman interviewer went well. We were both clear and candid with each other. The marketing department sounded like it was in transition so I don't feel they were clear in what they needed. I was over qualified but willing to take a lower position due to my life circumstances. I am writing this review to let others who interview know that they don't get back to you even if you politely email and leave phone messages asking for a courtesy call to let you know if the position was filled and where you stand in the process. During the interview she was very encouraging about my portfolio and potential of working in their department. They ask you questions of faith and integrity. Overall, disappointed that they seek others with faith and integrity but their actions don't shown those qualities. Actions in this case do speak louder than words. No decency in providing even a brief response. A return email or voicemail saying they weren't interested was simply right thing to do. Especially from a faith based college.
Interview Questions: One of the interview questions was would you be able to make a 2 year commitment.

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wheaton College (IL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: One interview with HR then one department interview. Great experience and flexible when needed with timeline. Not particularly difficult questions, especially in contrast to corporate interviews. Pretty standard process and overall was quick once called into the interview. Took a month since I applied to be called though.
Interview Questions: Would you say you are detail oriented?

title: Hospitality Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wheaton College (IL) (Wheaton, IL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Long process, have to get through HR first then at least 3 more interviews before an offer comes in. willing to fly you out for personal interview, also offered to fly my family out as well. It was a good interview experience and they make sure they are hiring the right person for the job. They are very selective.

title: Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Wheaton College (IL) (Wheaton, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was overkill. Interviewed with every department, department partners, etc. Two day process. As well as interview with the President of the College. I was not impressed with the interview format, talking to at least 50 people, with 50 different opinions, and always referencing (being compared to) the incumbent was not a good way to conduct interview. I also got the impression that some panel members had misconceived ideas about my content knowledge or that I could not relate to academically gifted students.

title: Unit Leader At HoneyRock Outdoor Center for Leadership Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Wheaton College (IL) (Wheaton, IL) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a 2-step interview process with Mallory Alpert and Ashley Kiley. The process began with the submission of an application in October. Following that, in November an interview was held with Mallory Alpert. Then, in December an interview was held with Ashley Kiley. An offer was given in January.
Interview Questions: Q: What are some challenges you expect to face this summer?

title: Residence Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wheaton College (IL) (Wheaton, IL) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Submit their application, solo interview with a panel of Residence Life staff members, group personal collage presentations. The staff was very friendly and warm, and welcomed you and made you feel very comfortable. They care so much about caring for those under them -- it's part of Wheaton College's Residence Life grander vision.

Altogether, I was very very excited and relaxed to interview with them.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wheaton College (IL) (Wheaton, IL) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant experience.   I was treated respectfully all along.  I was kept informed  and given timeframes of decision making.  Intelligent insightful interviewer and receptionist.  Good experience all around.  Testing took about 3 hours of unpaid time, but an investment.   Personality, general office skills, and microsoft office suite testing.  A total of 3 interviews for current position.
Interview Questions: What do you dislike about former jobs.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: After applying, there is a meeting with a panel, including two or three current RAs, a GRA or ARD and an RD. There is also what is called "RA collage" and you get the chance to express who you are through whatever medium you'd like. After that, all applicants receive a letter with a job offer or not
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an RA?

title: Reunion Giving Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wheaton College (IL) (Wheaton, IL) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very quick response to my resume, and easy to schedule interview.  If you come prepared, the interview will last over 1hr 30min, but be well worth it.  However, post-interview follow-up was sub-par at best.

title: Residence Hall Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Wheaton College (IL) (Wheaton, IL) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, than an all day campus interview. The campus interview involved a campus tour, 1 on 1 meetings with the Associate Dean, group interviews with RDs, another with GRAs, another with RAs, Another with Deans and Directors,
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions almost exclusively--i.e. tell me about a time when you handled a student in crisis.

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wheaton College (IL) (Wheaton, IL) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was brief and very simple. He just tried to get to know me and ask about me. The job is fairly easy so he just checked to see if I knew what I was doing.
Interview Questions: He asked if I knew what I was doing and why I wanted to work there and what hours I could work.

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wheaton College (IL) (Wheaton, IL) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: Not consistent with the expectations of someone committed to teaching.
Interview Questions: What is your view of the authority of the Bible?
